intro: Cochlearia oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed cochlearia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. Native to the British Isles, it thrives in coastal and maritime environments. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and blooms from late spring to early summer. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
